io.netty.channel

Interface ChannelHandlerUtil.SingleOutboundMessageHandler<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Base64Encoder, ByteArrayEncoder, ChannelOutboundMessageHandlerAdapter, CompatibleMarshallingEncoder, CompatibleObjectEncoder, HttpObjectEncoder, HttpRequestEncoder, HttpResponseEncoder, LengthFieldPrepender, MarshallingEncoder, MessageToByteEncoder, MessageToMessageEncoder, ObjectEncoder, ProtobufEncoder, ProtobufVarint32LengthFieldPrepender, RtspObjectEncoder, RtspRequestEncoder, RtspResponseEncoder, SocksMessageEncoder, SpdyFrameEncoder, SpdyHttpEncoder, StringEncoder, WebSocket00FrameEncoder, WebSocket07FrameEncoder, WebSocket08FrameEncoder, WebSocket13FrameEncoder
    Enclosing class:
    ChannelHandlerUtil

    public static interface ChannelHandlerUtil.SingleOutboundMessageHandler<T>

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean acceptOutboundMessage(Object msg)
      Returns true if and only if the specified message can be handled by this handler.
      boolean beginFlush(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Will get notified once ChannelOperationHandler.flush(ChannelHandlerContext, ChannelPromise) was called.
      void endFlush(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Is called when ChannelOperationHandler.flush(ChannelHandlerContext, ChannelPromise) returns.
      void flush(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, T msg)
      Is called once a message is being flushed.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptOutboundMessage

        boolean acceptOutboundMessage(Object msg)
                              throws Exception
        Returns true if and only if the specified message can be handled by this handler.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message
        Throws:
        Exception

      • beginFlush

        boolean beginFlush(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                   throws Exception
        Will get notified once ChannelOperationHandler.flush(ChannelHandlerContext, ChannelPromise) was called.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext which this ChannelHandler belongs to
        Returns:
        true to accept the flush request. false to reject the flush request and to fail the promise associated with the flush request with IncompleteFlushException.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • flush

        void flush(ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
         T msg)
           throws Exception
        Is called once a message is being flushed.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext which this ChannelHandler belongs to
        msg - the message to handle
        Throws:
        Exception

      • endFlush

        void endFlush(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
              throws Exception
        Is called when ChannelOperationHandler.flush(ChannelHandlerContext, ChannelPromise) returns. Super-classes may-override this for special handling.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext which this ChannelHandler belongs to
        Throws:
        Exception
